div.p: Minute book 2, Municipal Council records, Port Fairy, Victoria.

Transcribed 10.9.93. To proof.
Letter not found. May 1862
This request was minuted at a Municipal Council meeting of 7 May 1862.

[The Chairman, Councillor Mason and the Town Clerk were requested to draw up a list of trees shrubs &c and forward application for same to Dr Mueller, Edmund Glason Esq having kindly consented to take charge of the same and forward by Steamer.]
At a Council meeting of 16 July 1862 Councillor G. Haynes 'mentioned that as he had to proceed to Melbourne in a few days he would be glad to wait upon Dr Mueller and take charge of Trees & Plants for the Botanical Gardens —' (Minute book 2; Banner of Belfast, 22 July 1862, p. 3). Haynes duly reported at the Council meeting of 13 August: 'that in accordance with his promise he had called on Dr Mueller in Melbourne who had expressed regret at not receiving the letter addressed to him by the Council in May last, but that he would forward a box of young trees seeds &c, and had accordingly done so, and the plants and seeds wee now in the hands of the Curator of the Gardens [J. Prior]. The Council agreed to allow Prior assistance to have the same properly set out and planted —' (Minute book 2).
